title: Single-cell analysis of functional heterogeneity in DNA repair capacity
title_html: Single-cell analysis of functional heterogeneity in DNA repair capacity

authors.name: Jay Hesselberth
authors.affiliation: University of Colorado School of Medicine

authors.name: Amanda Richer
authors.affiliation: University of Colorado School of Medicine

source.description:
Follow the
10x protocol
(CG00052 Rev F / CG000075 Rev C) for GEM generation with the following changes:
1. Using the cell suspension volume calculator table, subtract 5 µl from the Volume of Nuclease-free Water.
2. Add 5 µl of 20x hairpin solution per sample to the MM after you have added nuclease-free water and before the cells are added to the MM (i.e., between steps 1.1C and 1.1D).
CRITICAL: You must add DNA repair substrates (polyadenylated hairpins) to nuclease-free water added to master mix.

source.title: 10x Kit Changes - Post GEM-RT Cleanup and cDNA amplification

source.description:
Follow 10x protocol for Post GEM-RT Cleanup - Silane Dynabeads protocol (section 2.1)
After elution from silane beads in 35 µl, perform an SPRIselect size selection:
  1. Vortex the SPRIselect Reagent (or Ampure XP) until fully resuspended.
  2. Add 0.6x volume of SPRIselect Reagent (21 µl) and pipette to mix.
  3. Incubate at room temperature for 5 min.
  4. Place on magnetic strip and wait until liquid is clear.
  5. DO NOT DISCARD SUPERNATANT. Transfer supernatant to new tube. This fraction will be referred to as the repair substrate fraction. The beads contain the mRNA fraction.
  6. Add 41 µl of SPRIselect Reagent (or Ampure XP) to the repair substrate fraction (1.8x) and pipette to mix.
  7. Incubate at room temperature for 5 min.
  8. While repair substrate fraction is incubating, add 150 µl 80% EtOH to the mRNA fraction while beads are still on magnet.
  9. Remove the 80% EtOH and repeat wash (step 8) for a total of 2 washes.
  10. Briefly spin down tubes and place back on magnet and remove remaining EtOH.
  11. Dry beads for 2 min.
  12. Add 35.5 µl EB buffer (from 10x reagents) and incubate for 2 min at room temperature.
  13. Place on magnet. Once liquid is clear, remove 35 µl and place into new tube - this is the mRNA fraction and will proceed to cDNA amplification step of the 10x protocol.
  14. After the 5 min incubate with 1.8X SPRIselect reagent, place the repair substrate fraction on the magnet
  15. Once the liquid is clear, remove and discard the supernatant.
  16. Add 100 µl 80% EtOH to the beads while the beads are still on the magnet.
  17. Remove the 80% EtOH and repeat wash (step 15) for a total of 2 washes.
  18. Briefly spin down tubes and place back on magnet and remove remaining EtOH.
  19. Dry beads for 2 min.
  20. Add 20.5 µl of nuclease-free water and incubate for 2 min at room temperature.
  21. Place on magnet and once liquid is clear, remove 20 µl and place into new tube - this is the repair substrate fraction and will proceed to repair substrate library prep.
Follow the remaining 10x protocol to finish mRNA library.

Mix the end repair mix on ice (
End repair kit from NEB
)
AB
1Water6 µl
210x End repair buffer (NEB)3 µl
3End repair enzyme mix (NEB)1 µl
Add the end repair mix to the 20 µl of repair substrate fraction isolated above.
Incubate at 20 °C for 30 minutes.
Clean up:
  1. Transfer end repair reaction to 1.5 mL eppendorf tube .
  2. Add 130 µl of 0.4 M sodium acetate to the end repair reaction.
  3. Add 400 µl 100% EtOH to the sodium acetate and end repair reaction mix.
  4. Add 1 µl of
  5. glyco-blue coprecipitate
  6. (optional).
  7. Vortex for 5 seconds to mix.
  8. Incubate at -20 °C for 30 minutes.
  9. Centrifuge precipitation at >10000 g for 10 minutes at 4 °C.
  10. Remove supernatant and add 500 µl 80% EtOH.
  11. Centrifuge again at >10000 g for 10 min at 4 °C.
  12. Remove supernatant carefully to not disturb the pellet.
  13. Let pellet dry for 5 min.
  14. Resuspend pellet in 20 µl nuclease free H2O.
Add 1 µl of
glyco-blue coprecipitate
(optional).
  1. Vortex for 5 seconds to mix.
  2. Incubate at -20 °C for 30 minutes.
  3. Centrifuge precipitation at >10000 g for 10 minutes at 4 °C.
  4. Remove supernatant and add 500 µl 80% EtOH.
  5. Centrifuge again at >10000 g for 10 min at 4 °C.
  6. Remove supernatant carefully to not disturb the pellet.
  7. Let pellet dry for 5 min.
  8. Resuspend pellet in 20 µl nuclease free H2O.

AB
1Water6 µl
210x End repair buffer (NEB)3 µl
3End repair enzyme mix (NEB)1 µl

Mix the following:
AB
1Water2 µl
210x Blue buffer (enzymatics)2 µl
310 mM dATP2 µl
4Klenow exo- (enzymatics)1 µl
5End-repaired repair substrate fraction (from previous step)13 µl
Incubate at 37 °C for 30 minutes.
  1. Transfer A-tailing reaction to 1.5 mL eppendorf tube.
  2. Add 130 µl of 0.4 M sodium acetate.
  3. Add 400 µl 100% EtOH.
  4. If concerned about seeing a pellet, add 1 µl glyco-blue coprecipitate.
  5. Vortex for 5 seconds to mix.
  6. Incubate at -20 for 30 minutes.
  7. Centrifuge precipitation at >10000 g for 10 minutes at 4 °C.
  8. Remove supernatant and add 500 µl 80% EtOH.
  9. Centrifuge again at >10000 g for 10 min at 4 °C.
  10. Remove supernatant carefully to not disturb the pellet.
  11. Let pellet dry for 5 min.
  12. Resuspend pellet in 20 µl nuclease free water.

AB
1Water2 µl
210x Blue buffer (enzymatics)2 µl
310 mM dATP2 µl
4Klenow exo- (enzymatics)1 µl
5End-repaired repair substrate fraction (from previous step)13 µl

Anneal adapters:
AB
1NameSequence
2Y adapter 1TCTGCACACGAGAAGGCTAG
3Y adapter 2ACACTCTTTCCCTACACGACGCTCTTCCGATCT
1. Mix 20 µl of each 100 µM adapter piece in 10 mM Tris pH 7.5, 50 mM NaCl (ST buffer).
2. Heat to 95 °C for 5 minutes then cool at -0.1 C/sec to 4 °C.
3. Add 160 µL of cold ST buffer to make 10 µM adapters.
4. Make 10 µL aliquots and freeze at -20 °C until ready to use.
5. When ready to use, thaw on ice. Do not freeze-thaw adapter aliquots.
Reaction mix:
AB
12x ligation buffer (enzymatics)15 µl
2Pre-annealed adapters - 10 µM1 µl
3T4 DNA ligase (Rapid) (enzymatics)1 µl
4A-tailed repair substrate fraction (from previous step)13 µl
Incubate at 20 °C for 30 min.
Ampure clean up (1.8x)
  1. Add 36 µl (1.8x) Ampure XP beads to ligation reaction.
  2. Incubate at room temperature for 5 minutes.
  3. Place on magnet.
  4. Once liquid is clear, remove and discard supernatant.
  5. Wash 2x with 150 µl 80% EtOH with beads on magnet.
  6. Dry beads for 2 min.
  7. Resuspend beads in 20 µl H2O and incubate for 2 minutes at room temperature.
  8. Place beads on magnet and once liquid is clear, transfer supernatant to another tube.

AB
1NameSequence
2Y adapter 1TCTGCACACGAGAAGGCTAG
3Y adapter 2ACACTCTTTCCCTACACGACGCTCTTCCGATCT

AB
12x ligation buffer (enzymatics)15 µl
2Pre-annealed adapters - 10 µM1 µl
3T4 DNA ligase (Rapid) (enzymatics)1 µl
4A-tailed repair substrate fraction (from previous step)13 µl

Set up master mix:
Indexed primers
AB
1NameSequence
2Forward indexed P5 primerCAAGCAGAAGACGGCATACGAGATNNNNNNNNGTGACTGGAGTTCAGACGTGTGCTCTTCCGA*T*C*T
3Reverse indexed P7 primerAATGATACGGCGACCACCGAGATCTACACNNNNNNNNTCTTTCCCTACACGACGCTCTTCCGA*T*C*T
Mix 10 µl of 100 µM forward and reverse primers and dilute to 100 µl to make 10 µM primers.
AB
1Water21 µl
25x Phusion buffer HF (NEB)10 µl
310 mM dNTPs2 µl
4Phusion (NEB)1 µl
  1. Add 34 µl master mix to PCR tube.
  2. Add 3 µl 10 µM mixed indexed ILMN primers to tubes, make sure each sample has a unique index.
  3. Add 13 µl repair substrate fraction from adapter ligation reaction to tube.
Thermal cycler:
ABC
1TemperatureTime
298 °C3 min
398 °C15 sec14-20 cycles
465 °C15 sec
572 °C15 sec
672 °C5 min
74 °CHold

3Reverse indexed P7 primerAATGATACGGCGACCACCGAGATCTACACNNNNNNNNTCTTTCCCTACACGACGCTCTTCCGA*T*C*T

AB
1Water21 µl
25x Phusion buffer HF (NEB)10 µl
310 mM dNTPs2 µl
4Phusion (NEB)1 µl

ABC

298 °C3 min

74 °CHold

Run 1 µl of PCR product on 10% 29:1 acrylamide TBE gel or on Agilent D1000 tapesation tape.
If there doesn't appear to be a library, add more Phusion to PCR reaction and do 2-5 more cycles of PCR.
Ampure cleanup
  1. Add 1x AmpureXP beads to PCR reaction (49 µL).
  2. Incubate at room temperature for 5 minutes.
  3. Place on magnet and once liquid is clear, remove and discard supernatant.
  4. Wash 2x with 200 µl 80% EtOH.
  5. Air dry for 2 minutes.
  6. Resuspend beads in 20.5 µl H20.
  7. Incubate at room temperature for 2 minutes.
  8. Place on magnet, and once liquid is clear transfer 20 µl to a new tube.
Sequence at least 28x100 to get all cell barcode and DNA repair information from library.

source.body: Library size should about 200-250 bp.

source.description:

CRITICAL: Do not follow the RT protocol from 10x protocols.

DNA repair substrates were designed as DNA hairpins containing a single modified base. The hairpin has a 20 nucleotide polyA single stranded region that enables hybridization to oligo-dT primers in the 10X GEMs.
AB
1SubstrateSequence
2A:U - 1/5SpC3/GTCGTGATGCATGCCTGTATGTGACACAAGTAATTGTGTCACAUACAGGCATGCATCACGACAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA/3SpC3/
3C:riboG - 1/5SpC3/ACTCGAGTCACACTCGTACTGATGCATGAGTAATCATGCATCArGTACGAGTGTGACTCGAGTAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA/3SpC3/
4G:U/5SpC3/TGAATTCGAGAGTCGTTCGGCGATATAACGTAAGTTATATCGCUGAACGACTCTCGAATTCAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA/3SpC3/
5G:Abasic/5SpC3/ACGTACGTTAGCATAACTGTAATCTTAATGTAAATTAAGATTA/idSp/AGTTATGCTAACGTACGTAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA/3SpC3/
6C:I/5SpC3/GAGCGCTACTCAGATGACTTCGAGTGATTGTAAAATCACTCGAIGTCATCTGAGTAGCGCTCAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA/3SpC3/
7T:I/5SpC3/AGTGCACGCTCTATGTATCGAAGAGTTGTGTAAACAACTCTTCIATACATAGAGCGTGCACTAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA/3SpC3/
8Normal/5SpC3/CGCTAGCCTTCAGCTATCTTCTACCCATCGTAAGATGGGTAGAAGATAGCTGAAGGCTAGCGAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA/3SpC3/
9A:U - 2/5C3Sp/GCTTGCCTTGTCGATCACAAGTATGTCAGGTAACTGACATACTUGTGATCGACAAGGCAAGCAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA/3C3Sp/
10A:U - 3/5C3Sp/GCTGGCCTTTGCACTAGGAACTTACCGCGGTAACGCGGTAAGTUCCTAGTGCAAAGGCCAGCAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA/3C3Sp/
11A:U - 4/5C3Sp/TGCCAACGGTGGAGTACGAGGTAAGAAGCGTAAGCTTCTTACCUCGTACTCCACCGTTGGCAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA/3C3Sp/
12A:U - 5/5C3Sp/ATGGTTCACGTGGGACATAGCGATCGTGCGTAAGCACGATCGCUATGTCCCACGTGAACCATAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA/3C3Sp/
13C:riboG - 2/5C3Sp/TCCGACGGCAAGAGTCCTCTCCAATTACCGTAAGGTAATTGGArGAGGACTCTTGCCGTCGGAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA/3C3Sp/
14C:riboG - 3/5C3Sp/TCAATTGTTGGCAGAGGCCAATTAGTGTCGTAAGACACTAATTrGGCCTCTGCCAACAATTGAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA/3C3Sp/
15C:riboG - 4/5C3Sp/TCGGACCAAGTTATGGGCCGCGAATTTCCGTAAGGAAATTCGCrGGCCCATAACTTGGTCCGAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA/3C3Sp/
16C:riboG - 5/5C3Sp/CTCAGACGAACGTTGCTACGGACCCGTATGTAAATACGGGTCCrGTAGCAACGTTCGTCTGAGAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA/3C3Sp/
Substrates were mixed and diluted to a 20x solution (200 nM - 2 µM) in nuclease-free water.
To get robust single cell measurements, substrates should be at least 100 nM each in 20x solution, however, we measured repair with substrates as low as 20 nM in 20x solution.

Below is an overview of the repair library preparation.

materials.name: Chromium Single Cell 3′ Library & Gel Bead Kit v2
ST Buffer (10 mM Tris 7.5 50 mM NaCl)

description: Methods to measure heterogeneity among cells are rapidly transforming our understanding of biology but are currently limited to static measurements of DNA, RNA, and protein abundance. We developed an approach to simultaneously measure biochemical activities and mRNA abundance in single cells to understand the heterogeneity of DNA repair across thousands of human lymphocytes, identifying known and novel cell-type-specific DNA repair phenotypes. Our method provides a general framework for understanding functional heterogeneity among single cells.
